messageBody:
In response to the classpath problems bearing witness on this list, I
decided to write a test. It's not a JUnit test, as that would require a
proper installation of JUnit. Rather, it's a variant of the JWhich
utility I wrote a while back to print the absolute location of a Java
class file as defined by the classpath.

I've uploaded this variant to the files section of this group as
WhichJUnit.java. Running this class will print the absolute location of
the JUnit class files required to run and test JUnit and its samples.
It also prints the absolute location of the 'excluded.properties' file
that will be applied when using the graphical UIs. Additionally, the
current classpath is printed with a report of any non-existent or
invalid classpath entries.

Let's give it a spin!


1. I haven't installed JUnit at all. The only thing in the classpath
is the directory containing WhichJUnit.class, so I can at least run it...

----

CLARKWARE://c/projects/whichjunit> java WhichJUnit

junit.framework.Assert class not found!
To run JUnit, add junit.jar to the classpath.

/junit/runner/excluded.properties not found!

junit.tests.AllTests class not found!
To test JUnit, add the JUnit installation directory to the classpath.

junit.samples.AllTests class not found!
To run the JUnit samples, add the JUnit installation directory to
the classpath.

Classpath:
c:/projects/whichjunit

----

As reported, I cannot run or test JUnit or its samples. Makes sense.


2. So I add junit.jar to the classpath, then run WhichJUnit again...

----

CLARKWARE://c/projects/whichjunit> java WhichJUnit

junit.framework.Assert class found in
'file:/C:/Tools/junit/junit.jar!/junit/framework/Assert.class'

/junit/runner/excluded.properties found in
'file:/C:/Tools/junit/junit.jar!/junit/runner/excluded.properties'

junit.tests.AllTests class not found!
To test JUnit, add the JUnit installation directory to the classpath.

junit.samples.AllTests class not found!
To run the JUnit samples, add the JUnit installation directory to
the classpath.

Classpath:
c:/projects/whichjunit
c:/Tools/junit/junit.jar

----

Now it finds the junit.framework.Assert class, as well as the default
'excluded.properties' file.

But I can't run the tests or the samples yet...


3. I add the JUnit installation directory to the classpath and rerun...

----

CLARKWARE://c/projects/whichjunit> java WhichJUnit

junit.framework.Assert class found in
'file:/C:/Tools/junit/junit.jar!/junit/framework/Assert.class'

/junit/runner/excluded.properties found in
'file:/C:/Tools/junit/junit.jar!/junit/runner/excluded.properties'

junit.tests.AllTests class found in
'/C:/Tools/junit/junit/tests/AllTests.class'

junit.samples.AllTests class found in
'/C:/Tools/junit/junit/samples/AllTests.class'

Classpath:
c:/projects/whichjunit
c:/Tools/junit/junit.jar
c:/Tools/junit

----

Great! Now it finds the junit.tests.AllTests and junit.samples.AllTests
classes. So I can test JUnit and run its samples.

OK, so I want to override the default 'excluded.properties' file
distributed with JUnit. I create the following file:

c:/projects/myjunit/junit/runner/excluded.properties

Then I put the 'c:/projects/myjunit' directory in the classpath, making
sure that it's _before_ the junit.jar file.

Did it work? Let' see...

----

CLARKWARE://c/projects/whichjunit> java WhichJUnit

junit.framework.Assert class found in
'file:/C:/Tools/junit/junit.jar!/junit/framework/Assert.class'

/junit/runner/excluded.properties found in
'file:/C:/Tools/junit/junit.jar!/junit/runner/excluded.properties'

junit.tests.AllTests class found in
'/C:/Tools/junit/junit/tests/AllTests.class'

junit.samples.AllTests class found in
'/C:/Tools/junit/junit/samples/AllTests.class'

Classpath:
c:/projects/mjunit
c:/projects/whichjunit
c:/Tools/junit/junit.jar
c:/Tools/junit

'c:/projects/mjunit' does not exist.

----

No! It's still using the default 'excluded.properties' file. Why?

Oh, check out the bottom of the report. The classpath entry is invalid
- I misspelled 'myjunit'.

Fix it up and rerun...

----

CLARKWARE://c/projects/whichjunit> java WhichJUnit

junit.framework.Assert class found in
'file:/C:/Tools/junit/junit.jar!/junit/framework/Assert.class'

/junit/runner/excluded.properties found in
'/C:/projects/myjunit/junit/runner/excluded.properties'

junit.tests.AllTests class found in
'/C:/Tools/junit/junit/tests/AllTests.class'

junit.samples.AllTests class found in
'/C:/Tools/junit/junit/samples/AllTests.class'

Classpath:
c:/projects/myjunit
c:/projects/whichjunit
c:/Tools/junit/junit.jar
c:/Tools/junit

----

Yeah! It finds my custom 'excluded.properties' file first in the
classpath. The Swing GUI should work now.

(Now if only I can get folks to use this utility _before_ asking
classpath questions!)

Enjoy!

Mike
